meanings.definition: The beliefs or practices of a quack.
meanings.sent1: Many people fell for the quackisms of the fake doctor.
meanings.sent2: Doctors warn against quackisms that can harm your health.
meanings.sent3: The quackisms of the charlatan were exposed by a real physician.
meanings.sent4: Her quackisms were like a mask hiding her true intentions.
meanings.sent5: The quackisms of the fraudster were finally revealed to the public.

meanings.definition: The use of fraudulent or unproven methods in medicine.
meanings.sent1: Avoid quackisms when seeking medical treatment.
meanings.sent2: The hospital strictly prohibits any quackisms in patient care.
meanings.sent3: His quackisms in medicine led to dangerous consequences.
meanings.sent4: The quackisms of the unlicensed practitioner were a danger to patients.
meanings.sent5: Learning to recognize quackisms can protect you from medical scams.

meanings.definition: The characteristic speech or behavior of a quack.
meanings.sent1: Her quackisms were easy to spot by the experienced doctors.
meanings.sent2: The audience laughed at the quackisms of the fake healer.
meanings.sent3: His exaggerated quackisms entertained the crowd at the fair.
meanings.sent4: The politician's promises sounded like quackisms to the voters.
meanings.sent5: The quackisms of the con artist fooled many unsuspecting individuals.
